name: 9x19mm ETC HVHP
description: 9x19mm Electrothermal-chemical ammunition with a 116gr high velocity hollow point bullet. HVHP rounds maximize stopping power at about 150% higher muzzle velocity than conventional 9mm JHP.

name: 9x19mm ETC FMJ
description: 9x19mm Electrothermal-chemical ammunition with a brass jacketed 115gr bullet.  A popular round for military, law enforcement, and civilian use even after almost 150 years, adapted to a new ballistic propulsion technology.

name: 9x19mm ETC HVAP
description: 9x19mm Electrothermal-chemical ammunition with a high velocity armor-piercing 60gr bullet, which should suffice for anything besides power armor.

name: 9x19mm ETC HAPM
description: Electrothermal-chemical ammunition with a superalloy 40gr hypervelocity armor-piercing match bullet with a tungsten core. Designed to defeat power armor, it can exceed 1100 meters per second. It is inefficient against unarmored threats.

name: 9x19mm ETC SAP
description: Electrothermal-chemical ammunition with a depleted uranium 262gr subsonic armor-piercing bullet. A quiet, heavy, accurate, low recoil round with better armor penetration than HVAP. Negligible overpenetration compensates lower muzzle energy.
